intro: Obione rusbyi, commonly known as the Rusby's obione, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant has a compact growth habit with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and requires a cool, humid environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Obione rusbyi is considered endangered and is of great interest to botanists and conservationists.
